positive: But here is the model I would recommend for you to search; (This would be the best fit for you in school, I don’t know the price in your country but in here its around 82.000 TL which is around 2100€ )

Based on that research I've decided to move forward on my purchase but have switched from the AMD to the Intel processor since the Intel model is newer, has an improved chasis, & has a lot of newly improved features that support more future proofing and quality of life than the older AMD model.

But that’s OK, because I still got a solid 9–10.5 hours under heavy, real-world use: * 20–30 tabs open * Zoom app + Teams (web) * YouTube music streaming * Constant typing * Screen at ~70% Compared to my aging HP, which lasts about 4–5 hours now, this is a major win.

The keys feel a little shallower than on the HP 14c, but once I got into a groove, I had no complaints.

I’ve always been a sucker for high-capacity drives, so the tiny 512 GB of space made me feel uneasy every single time I thought about my locally stored movies, TV shows, comics, games… Point is: I wanted to upgrade.

The trip to Micro Center, the fact that I was actually upgrading a laptop, the excitement I felt going into the Amazon Locker to retrieve my shiny new 32 gigs of RAM… Truly a wonderful experience.

As some who gets serious FOMO, I personally skipped AMD for this year’s Yoga 7 lineup ‘cause I find the Intel one is better for school for the battery life difference, but otherwise I think the AMD Yoga 7 is still fairly well rounded and great on a tighter budget, and battery life is still decent.
